original: @237b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @237b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: badzra yo gi n'i p'u dza bi dhi //
analyzed: badzra yo gi n'i p'u dza bi dhi //
translated: Vajrayoginipūjāvidhi

original: bod skad du //
analyzed: bod skad du //
translated: In Tibetan:🔽The Ritual of the Worship of Vajrayoginī

original: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i mchod pa'i cho ga / dpal rdo rje rnal 'byor ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i mchod pa'i cho ga / dpal rdo rje rnal 'byor ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrayoginī.

original: de nas man ngag las byung ba'i mchod pa'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas man ngag las byung ba'i mchod pa'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the ritual of worship that arises from the esoteric instructions should be stated.

original: aom a'a: raksha raksha h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: raksha raksha h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ rakṣa rakṣa hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes pas sa sbyang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pas sa sbyang ngo //
translated: With this, purify the ground.

original: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas dang / zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dang / tshogs pa dang nye ba'i tshogs pa dang / 'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du ba can dang / p'a la ba dang / au pi p'a la ba dang / dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod dang zhes brjod cing /
analyzed: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas dang / zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dang / tshogs pa dang nye ba'i tshogs pa dang / 'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du ba can dang / p'a la ba dang / au pi p'a la ba dang / dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod dang zhes brjod cing /
translated: The place, the nearby place, the field, the nearby field, the assembly, the nearby assembly, the gathering, the nearby gathering, the Pālava, the Upapālava, the charnel ground, and the nearby charnel ground.

original: mandala nye bar byugs la /
analyzed: mandala nye bar byugs la /
translated: Having anointed the maṇḍala,

original: de'i dbus su rtsibs drug pa'i chos 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus su rtsibs drug pa'i chos 'byung ste /
translated: in the center of that, there is a six-spoked dharmodaya.

original: de'i dbus su yi ge bam dang ldan pa bri'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su yi ge bam dang ldan pa bri'o //
translated: In the center of that, one should draw the syllable vaṃ.

original: aom sarba buddha d'a ki n'i ye /
analyzed: aom sarba buddha d'a ki n'i ye /
translated: Oṃ sarva buddha dakiniye |

original: badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom badzra warnna n'i ye /🔽badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom badzra bee ro tsa n'i yi /🔽aom badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom aam a'am h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a / aom badzra warnna n'i ye / badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a / aom badzra bee ro tsa n'i yi / aom badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a / aom aam a'am h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽oṃ vajra varṇanīye vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽oṃ vajra vairocanīye vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽oṃ aṃ āṃ hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽

original: aom aim a'im h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom hum h'um h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom rim r'im h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom lim l'im h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom hem aeem h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom aom aoom h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom aam a'am h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽bcom ldan 'das ma'i rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags 'dis mchod par bya'o //🔽aom bam badzra b'a r'a h'i /🔽badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom ham yom /
analyzed: aom aim a'im h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom hum h'um h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom rim r'im h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom lim l'im h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom hem aeem h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom aom aoom h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom aam a'am h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽bcom ldan 'das ma'i rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags 'dis mchod par bya'o //🔽aom bam badzra b'a r'a h'i /🔽badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom ham yom /
translated: Oṃ aiṃ āiṃ hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽Oṃ huṃ hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽Oṃ riṃ rāiṃ hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽Oṃ liṃ lāiṃ hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽Oṃ heṃ aiṃ hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽Oṃ aṃ āṃ oṃ auṃ hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽Oṃ aṃ āṃ hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽One should make offerings with this eight-line mantra of the Blessed Lady.🔽Oṃ vaṃ vajra-vārāhī.🔽Vajra-puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽Oṃ haṃ yoṃ.

original: ya mi n'i badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ya mi n'i badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: The mantra of Yamini is Oṃ vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: aom hrim mom h'a n'i /🔽badra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hrim mom h'a n'i / badra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: The mantra of Hāninī is Oṃ hrīṃ mom hā ninī vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: aom hrem hrim /🔽panydza l'i n'i /
analyzed: aom hrem hrim / panydza l'i n'i /
translated: The mantra of Hriṃhrim is Oṃ hrīṃ hrīṃ vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom h'um h'um santra sa n'i /
analyzed: badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a / aom h'um h'um santra sa n'i /
translated: The mantra of Pañcalāninī is Oṃ hrīṃ hrīṃ vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom phat phat /
analyzed: badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a / aom phat phat /
translated: The mantra of Santrasaninī is Oṃ hūṃ hūṃ santrasaninī vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: tsandi k'a / badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: tsandi k'a / badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: The mantra of Caṇḍikā is Oṃ phaṭ phaṭ caṇḍikā vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: rnal 'byor ma drug gi sngags te 'dis g-yon skor gyis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma drug gi sngags te 'dis g-yon skor gyis mchod par bya'o //
translated: These are the mantras of the six yoginīs. One should worship with them in a counterclockwise direction.

original: yang aom ao di ya na /🔽badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom p'urna gi ri /
analyzed: yang aom ao di ya na / badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a / aom p'urna gi ri /
translated: Again, the mantra of Oḍiyānī is Oṃ oḍiyāne vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽 The mantra of Pūrṇagiri is Oṃ pūrṇagiri vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom k'a ma r'u pa /🔽badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a / aom k'a ma r'u pa / badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: The mantra of Kāmarūpa is Oṃ kāmarūpe vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽 The mantra of Śrīhaṭṭa is Oṃ śrīhaṭṭa vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: aom shr'i h'atta badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom shr'i h'atta badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: The mantra of Godāvarī is Oṃ godāvarī vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes pas shar la sogs pa dang / de'i rjes su dbang ldan la sogs pa'i mtshams @238a * //
analyzed: zhes pas shar la sogs pa dang / de'i rjes su dbang ldan la sogs pa'i mtshams @238a * //
translated: After that, in the northeast and so forth,🔽one should offer with:

original: su ni / aom dharmma k'a ya /
analyzed: su ni / aom dharmma k'a ya /
translated: Oṃ dharmakāya

original: badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom sam bho ga k'a ya badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a / aom sam bho ga k'a ya badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: vajra puṣpe aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽Oṃ sambhogakāya🔽vajra puṣpe aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽Oṃ nirmanakāya

original: aom ni rmmana k'a ya badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ni rmmana k'a ya badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: vajra puṣpe aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: aom badzra ma h'a su kh'a kh'a ya /🔽badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra ma h'a su kh'a kh'a ya / badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vajra mahāsukha kāya🔽vajra puṣpe aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽Oṃ vajra ḍākinī

original: aom badzra d'a ki n'i yi badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra d'a ki n'i yi badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: vajra puṣpe aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: aom l'a me /🔽badzra / pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom l'a me / badzra / pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ lāmā🔽vajra puṣpe aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽Oṃ khaṇḍarohiṇī

original: aom khanda ro he badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom khanda ro he badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: vajra puṣpe aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽Oṃ rūpiṇi

original: aom r'u pi ni ye aom badra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom r'u pi ni ye aom badra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: vajra puṣpe aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: logs bzhi'i dga' ba 'khyil ba la mchod pa ni /
analyzed: logs bzhi'i dga' ba 'khyil ba la mchod pa ni /
translated: The offerings to the four sides of the courtyard are:

original: aom nan dya bardha /
analyzed: aom nan dya bardha /
translated: Oṃ nandā

original: badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: badzra pushpe a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: vajra puṣpe aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes pa'o // aom aam a'am /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // aom aam a'am /
translated: Om am aam.

original: aim a'im / aum a'um /
analyzed: aim a'im / aum a'um /
translated: Im aam. Um aum.

original: rim r'im / lim l'im /
analyzed: rim r'im / lim l'im /
translated: Rim raim. Lim laim.

original: aem aeem / aom aoom /
analyzed: aem aeem / aom aoom /
translated: Em aem. Om aom.

original: aam a'am phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aam a'am phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Am aam phat svaha.

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das ma'i phreng ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das ma'i phreng ba'i sngags so //
translated: This is the garland mantra of the Blessed Lady.

original: gtor ma'i cho ga ni mdun du gtor ma'i snod zan la sogs pas yongs su gar ba bdud rtsi'i cho gas yongs su spyad ba byas nas /
analyzed: gtor ma'i cho ga ni mdun du gtor ma'i snod zan la sogs pas yongs su gar ba bdud rtsi'i cho gas yongs su spyad ba byas nas /
translated: The rite of the sacrificial cake: in front, in a sacrificial cake vessel, one should prepare a sacrificial cake of rice and so forth, and treat it with the rite of nectar.

original: de'i rjes su /
analyzed: de'i rjes su /
translated: After that,

original: aom aa ralli ho /
analyzed: aom aa ralli ho /
translated: Om aralli ho.

original: dza: h'um bamho: sa ma ya /
analyzed: dza: h'um bamho: sa ma ya /
translated: Jham hum bam ho. Samaya.

original: ma nu p'a la ya /
analyzed: ma nu p'a la ya /
translated: Manupalaya.

original: dri shyaho// aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi /
analyzed: dri shyaho// aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi /
translated: Drisya ho. Om khakha khaha.🔽Khai khai.🔽Sarvaya ksha.

original: sarbba yaksha / r'aksha sa /
analyzed: sarbba yaksha / r'aksha sa /
translated: Rakshasa.

original: sarbba bh'u ta pre ta /
analyzed: sarbba bh'u ta pre ta /
translated: Sarvabhuta preta.

original: pi sh'a tsa sma ra aa pa sma ra d'a ka /d'a ki n+ya da ya /
analyzed: pi sh'a tsa sma ra aa pa sma ra d'a ka /d'a ki n+ya da ya /
translated: Pishacha smara apasmara dakini dakini dayaka.🔽Imima.

original: ai mim / bam lim /
analyzed: ai mim / bam lim /
translated: Vam lima.

original: grihnantu / sa ma yam /
analyzed: grihnantu / sa ma yam /
translated: Ghrinantusamayam.

original: rakshantu / ma ma sarbba siddhim mme /
analyzed: rakshantu / ma ma sarbba siddhim mme /
translated: Rakshantu mam sarvasiddhim mamme.

original: pra ya tstshantu /🔽ya thee bam /
analyzed: pra ya tstshantu / ya thee bam /
translated: Prayacchantu.🔽Yathevam.

original: ya theeshtam / bhunydza tha /
analyzed: ya theeshtam / bhunydza tha /
translated: Yatheshtam. Bhunja tha.

original: pi pa tha /
analyzed: pi pa tha /
translated: Pipatha.

original: dzi ghra tha /
analyzed: dzi ghra tha /
translated: Jighatha.

original: ma ti kra ma tha /
analyzed: ma ti kra ma tha /
translated: Mati kramatha.

original: ma ma / sarbba k'arta ya /🔽satshu kha / bi briddha ye /🔽sa ha yi k'a bha bantu h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ma ma / sarbba k'arta ya / satshu kha / bi briddha ye / sa ha yi k'a bha bantu h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Svaha!

original: zhes pa ni gtor ma'i cho ga gcig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gtor ma'i cho ga gcig go //
translated: This is the ritual of the bali offering.

original: yang na lha mo'i sngags nyid kyis lha la dbul lo //
analyzed: yang na lha mo'i sngags nyid kyis lha la dbul lo //
translated: Alternatively, one should offer to the deity with the goddess's mantra itself.

original: phag zhal ma'i phyi'i mchod pa'i gtong ma'i cho ga'o /
analyzed: phag zhal ma'i phyi'i mchod pa'i gtong ma'i cho ga'o /
translated: This is the ritual of the external bali offering of Varahi.

original: // / dang po rang gi mdun du gang yang rung ba snang ba de bcom ldan 'das ma'i gzugs su lhag par mos te de nyid rang la bstim par bya'o //
analyzed: // / dang po rang gi mdun du gang yang rung ba snang ba de bcom ldan 'das ma'i gzugs su lhag par mos te de nyid rang la bstim par bya'o //
translated: First, whatever appears in front of oneself, one should imagine it as the form of the Blessed Lady and dissolve it into oneself.

original: gnyis pa ni bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ma'i gzugs su bsgom zhing brtan g-yo'i bdag nyid sna tshogs pa'i rnam par bcom ldan 'das ma'i gzugs su bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ma'i gzugs su bsgom zhing brtan g-yo'i bdag nyid sna tshogs pa'i rnam par bcom ldan 'das ma'i gzugs su bsgom pa'o //
translated: Second, one should meditate on oneself as the form of the Blessed Lady and meditate on the various forms of the animate and inanimate world as the form of the Blessed Lady.

original: gsum pa ni de rnams bdag la thim par bsams nas 'khor 'das dbyer med par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni de rnams bdag la thim par bsams nas 'khor 'das dbyer med par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Third, having imagined that they dissolve into oneself, one should meditate on the inseparability of samsara and nirvana.

original: bzhi pa ni bcom lnga 'das ma'i rnal 'byor du dmigs shing srin po'i zhal bsdams te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bcom lnga 'das ma'i rnal 'byor du dmigs shing srin po'i zhal bsdams te /
translated: The fourth is the yoga of Bhagavatī, visualizing the rakshasa face, and binding it.

original: lte bar padma dmar po 'dab ma bzhi pa de la lnga pa lnga'i gsum pa'i n'a da las phyir 'byung ba'i rlung gi nyi ma lta bu'i skud pa'i rnam pas phyir @238b byung nas nang du rgyu ba'i rlung gi n'a da de kho na la thim pa ste
analyzed: lte bar padma dmar po 'dab ma bzhi pa de la lnga pa lnga'i gsum pa'i n'a da las phyir 'byung ba'i rlung gi nyi ma lta bu'i skud pa'i rnam pas phyir @238b byung nas nang du rgyu ba'i rlung gi n'a da de kho na la thim pa ste
translated: In the navel, there is a red four-petaled lotus. On that, from the nada of the third vowel of the fifth [o], a thread-like wind like the sun radiates outward and dissolves into the nada of the wind that moves inside.

original: de nyid phyag rgya'o /
analyzed: de nyid phyag rgya'o /
translated: That is the seal.

original: // / lnga pa ni rkang pa gnyis kyi bar du byung ba'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / lte ba'i 'og tu yi ge ram las me'i dkyil 'khor dang / de'i steng du lte ba la padma dmar po 'dab ma bzhi la de la lnga pa lnga'i gsum pa'i n'a da las phyir 'phro ba'i 'od zer gyis bcom ldan 'das ma'i sku lus thams cad 'od zer gyi rang bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: // / lnga pa ni rkang pa gnyis kyi bar du byung ba'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / lte ba'i 'og tu yi ge ram las me'i dkyil 'khor dang / de'i steng du lte ba la padma dmar po 'dab ma bzhi la de la lnga pa lnga'i gsum pa'i n'a da las phyir 'phro ba'i 'od zer gyis bcom ldan 'das ma'i sku lus thams cad 'od zer gyi rang bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The fifth is the wind mandala that arises between the two legs, the fire mandala from the syllable raṃ below the navel, and above that, on the navel, a red four-petaled lotus. On that, from the nada of the third vowel of the fifth [o], light radiates and the entire body of Bhagavatī is meditated on as the nature of light.

original: drug pa la 'od zer dang bcas pa'i sku lus de nyid du /
analyzed: drug pa la 'od zer dang bcas pa'i sku lus de nyid du /
translated: On the sixth, that very body with light

original: ji ltar dbugs rlung me long la //
analyzed: ji ltar dbugs rlung me long la //
translated: just like the wind and the mirror

original: kun du thim par 'gyur ba nyid //
analyzed: kun du thim par 'gyur ba nyid //
translated: completely dissolves.

original: de bzhin rnal 'byor yang dag mthar //
analyzed: de bzhin rnal 'byor yang dag mthar //
translated: In the same way, the yogi

original: yang dang yang du rab tu thim //
analyzed: yang dang yang du rab tu thim //
translated: again and again dissolves into the perfect end.

original: zhes pa'i rim pa 'dis thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rim pa 'dis thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: By this process, one should meditate on everything as emptiness.

original: stong pa'i rang bzhin de las lnga pa lnga'i gsum pa nyi ma lta bu de'i steng du mgo thur du 'phyang ba'i shi da gang ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin lnga pa lnga'i gsum pa'i 'od zer gyis bzhu nas sngar bshad pa'i n'a da de nyid
analyzed: stong pa'i rang bzhin de las lnga pa lnga'i gsum pa nyi ma lta bu de'i steng du mgo thur du 'phyang ba'i shi da gang ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin lnga pa lnga'i gsum pa'i 'od zer gyis bzhu nas sngar bshad pa'i n'a da de nyid
translated: From that nature of emptiness, on the fifth of the fifth, like the sun, upside down, the head of the skull filled with bodhicitta, the nature of the fifth of the fifth, melts with the light rays of the sun.

original: la rab tu thim ste /
analyzed: la rab tu thim ste /
translated: That nāḍī explained before completely dissolves into that.

original: de nas lnga pa lnga'i gsum pa'i n'a da des zung 'jug gi gzugs can bcom ldan 'das ma bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lnga pa lnga'i gsum pa'i n'a da des zung 'jug gi gzugs can bcom ldan 'das ma bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, with that nāḍī of the fifth of the fifth, one should meditate on the form of the Bhagavatī of union.

original: khyad par du srin po'i zhal bsdams nas /
analyzed: khyad par du srin po'i zhal bsdams nas /
translated: In particular, having bound the rākṣasa’s mouth,

original: phreng ba gsum mam bdun rnam par bsgoms la lte bar lnga pa lnga'i gsum pa'i n'a da'i 'od zer gyis shi da gang bzhu ba gnyi gas bde ba chen po gcig tu gyur te /
analyzed: phreng ba gsum mam bdun rnam par bsgoms la lte bar lnga pa lnga'i gsum pa'i n'a da'i 'od zer gyis shi da gang bzhu ba gnyi gas bde ba chen po gcig tu gyur te /
translated: Visualize three or seven garlands, and at the navel, the five of the third [garland] are filled with the light rays of the nāda. The two melt the śa, and both become one great bliss.

original: chos 'byung nas 'thon nas /
analyzed: chos 'byung nas 'thon nas /
translated: It emerges from the source of phenomena.

original: srin po'i zhal bsngags pa'i 'od zer gyis 'khor lo lta bur 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: srin po'i zhal bsngags pa'i 'od zer gyis 'khor lo lta bur 'khor ba'o //
translated: The light rays of the sealed mouth of the rākṣasa spin like a wheel.

original: khyad par gnyis pa ni srin po'i zhal bsdams pa'i 'od zer gyi lce'i mdun du g-yung drung dmar po 'khor zhing rna ba g-yon pa'i la la n'a'i 'og sgo nas chos 'byung du song ste /
analyzed: khyad par gnyis pa ni srin po'i zhal bsdams pa'i 'od zer gyi lce'i mdun du g-yung drung dmar po 'khor zhing rna ba g-yon pa'i la la n'a'i 'og sgo nas chos 'byung du song ste /
translated: The second special [practice] is that the light rays of the sealed mouth of the rākṣasa spin a red swastika in front of the tongue, and in the left ear, below the nāda, it enters the source of phenomena from the lower door.

original: phreng ba gsum mam bdun gyis g-yon skor 'khor lo lta bur 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: phreng ba gsum mam bdun gyis g-yon skor 'khor lo lta bur 'khor ba'o //
translated: Three or seven garlands spin like a wheel to the left.

original: grub pa thob pa rnams kyi man ngag las byung ba //
analyzed: grub pa thob pa rnams kyi man ngag las byung ba //
translated: This is from the intimate instructions of the adepts.

original: dpal rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i man ngag slob dpon chen po d'a ri ka pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i man ngag slob dpon chen po d'a ri ka pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The intimate instruction of Śrī Vajrayoginī composed by the great master Dārikapa is complete.

original: // / rgya gar shar phyogs dza ga ta la'i pandi ta chen po d'a na sh'i las bod yul dbus kyi drang srong srin po rir rang 'gyur du mdzad pa'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar shar phyogs dza ga ta la'i pandi ta chen po d'a na sh'i las bod yul dbus kyi drang srong srin po rir rang 'gyur du mdzad pa'o//
translated: Translated in the central land of Tibet, at the mountain of the Rishis, the Rakshasas, by the great Indian pandit of the east, Dana Slla, who translated it himself.
